articles.author: Tom Balmforth, Emma Farge, Sabine Siebold
articles.description: The U.S. is refusing to co-sponsor a draft U.N. resolution marking three years since Moscow's invasion of Ukraine that backs Kyiv's territorial integrity and condemns Russian aggression, in a potential stark shift by Ukraine's most powerful Western ally.
articles.title: Exclusive: US will not co-sponsor UN motion backing Ukraine

articles.author: James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israel braced on Thursday for the return of the bodies of infant Kfir Bibas and his four-year-old brother Ariel, the two youngest captives taken by Hamas in their Oct. 7, 2023 attack and among the most potent symbols of the trauma inflicted that day.
articles.title: Israel prepares to receive bodies of youngest Gaza hostages

articles.author: Olena Harmash, Tom Balmforth
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said he was counting on Ukrainian and European unity and U.S. pragmatism as Kyiv faces a mounting crisis in relations with its hitherto key U.S. ally.
articles.title: Zelenskiy calls for US pragmatism after Trump calls him a 'dictator'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Spain's High Court said on Thursday it had found former soccer federation boss Luis Rubiales guilty of sexual assault for kissing player Jenni Hermoso without her consent, and set a fine of over 10,000 euros ($10,434.00), but acquitted him of coercion.
articles.title: Spanish court sentences ex-soccer boss Rubiales to pay fine over kiss without consent

articles.author: Anson Law, James Pomfret
articles.description: Hong Kong's Democratic Party said late on Thursday it would start preparations to disband and wind up its affairs after a meeting of its leadership, amid a years-long national security crackdown in the China-ruled city.
articles.title: Hong Kong's last major pro-democracy party moves to disband

articles.author: Margaryta Chornokondratenko, Anastasiia Malenko
articles.description: As the air raid siren sounded for a ballistic missile threat in Kyiv, dozens of eight-year-old children descended into their primary school's basement with pencils and textbooks to continue class.
articles.title: Emotional trauma piles up for Ukraine's children three years after invasion

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Haiti court has thrown out a prior summons order against three members of the Caribbean nation's ruling transitional presidential council who have been accused of corruption, local newspaper Le Nouvelliste reported on Wednesday.
articles.title: Haiti court throws out summons for top leaders in corruption case, newspaper reports

articles.author: Jacob Gronholt-Pedersen
articles.description: Greenland's ruling Inuit Ataqatigiit party said it will not rush an independence vote through after a March 11 general election, cautioning about possible economic and welfare implications.
articles.title: Greenland's ruling IA party cautious about swift independence vote

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A motorcade carrying South Korea's impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol arrived on Thursday at the Seoul Central District Court, where the embattled leader is due to attend the first hearing of his criminal trial over insurrection charges.
articles.title: South Korea's Yoon set to attend his first criminal trial hearing

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva said on Thursday that if charges against his predecessor Jair Bolsonaro in a 2022 coup plot are proven true, he should be imprisoned.
articles.title: Brazil's Lula says Bolsonaro should be convicted if charges prove true
